reviews.text: I've traveled so much for business that I often wake up and wonder where I am.
reviews.title: Especially good value for pet owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In Port Angeles, I woke up and my old dog was right there next to the bed and it didn't really matter where I was--IT WAS VACATION!!
reviews.title: Good place to stay on a budget
Yuck, yuck, yuck
reviews.text: This is just a plain hotel with all the usual amenities. There's a nice sized fridge, micro wave, good hot water in the shower, and good wifi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The big value here is that they don't charge extra for pets. A per-pet, per-night fee seems to be common on the Olympic Peninsula, and this place doesn't charge it.
reviews.title: Book online!

reviews.text: We booked this hotel off of Hotwire and got a good deal on it. Our room was very clean and in good repair. The bed was wonderful. The breakfast was basic but ok. Location was wonderful real close to the ferry terminal and easy access to the National Park.
reviews.title: Great choice for 3 beds in Port Angeles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed overnight for a ferry ride to Victoria Canada the next morning, staff was friendly, restaurant up the hill was okay (a bit pricey for the food in my opinion) and the room was clean.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean and convenient

reviews.text: This is the off season, they had almost no one there. We had all we needed. They are in the middle of a renovation but it didn't bother us.
reviews.title: The best value and location!

reviews.text: It appears as though they keep this place up well.
reviews.title: Old but solid, needs bathroom renos badly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot find anything wrong to report, would stay if I were in the area again. Cannot speak for price/value much as we got the room free with our Wyndham Rewards points, but I'd say it should be priced in the 45-70 range depending on time of year.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whenever I travel for weekend trips to the Olmpic Peninsula, I stay at the Days Inn... Not only is it conveniently located in the center of Port Angeles, close to everything you want to do and everywhere you want to go, the hotel is nice, clean and provides the best value in the area. The building might be a little older than the hotels in Seattle, but given the hotels in the area, you can't be this hotel.
reviews.title: O.K. For One Night

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and it was a nice place for us. Price was a good value. Staff was very good--they have computers you can use if you need to, which helped us out. Room was nice and clean and comfy. Appreciated the thick towels! Breakfast was good. We enjoyed it. As budget travelers, we felt like this was a great place for us.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here on our way back to vancouver island on the ferry as it was pet friendly and close to the ferry terminal for an early morning departure. the room was facing the 101 highway on the lower floor and was terribly noisy from truck traffic and very thin walls and squeaky ceiling. the entire night provided about two hours sleep. according to a previous review the beds were new, if that was the case the box springs were old, and torn. Front counter female staff member was helpful, and pleasant. the area is ok for pet walking and is close to local restaurants. The morning breakfast was cheap and not well stocked, green bananas, bread, and packages muffins, and cereal. the rates were very competive from online booking but even at 56.00 was about 15.00 to high. if you need pet friendly look elsewhere
reviews.title: Noisy but inexpensive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: chased out of our campground by the pouring rain, we showed up with no reservation before noon, and not only we were allowed to check in early, (we needed to dry everything we owned), we we're given an upgraded suite for the AAA price when the first room we were given turned out not to be ready. the room and the bed were comfortable and clean, and the towels were good quality and thick. There's a nice hot tub, it's a short drive to the victoria ferry and the woman at the front desk was great!
reviews.title: comfortable, great service!

reviews.text: I found this Motel to be super nice. We liked it so well we made it our homebase for 4 nights and went sight seeing everyday. Very comfortable beds, new carpets, clean and covienent.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, clean, new beds, new carpet, excellent Motel.

reviews.text: I would recommend this motel to ANYONE staying in the Port Angeles area.From what I understand from talking to people in town, this Motel was just recently purchased by Days Inn, so they have renovated it. Listed in AAA and on computer as Queen size beds only, but they have NEW King size beds in many rooms now. Very pleased with out stay.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: My daughter was getting married August 14, 2010. There was a group rate for all who were staying. However, not everyone was arriving at the same time. The hotel put the groups under one date and never entered in the dates of the guests who called and advised when they were arriving. Had to argue with desk clerks who were clueless and would not make a decision. Manager was not available. Every single person (over 40 guests) who stayed there had there reservations messed up. The hotel then was going to charge everyone extra nights and different rates. Sprinkler system in suite leaked all day and night. Would never recommend this hotel to anyone, and definitely get something in writing if you do stay....don't do anything over the phone. confirmation number means nothing, as they enter wrong dates in computer and then try and blame the computer. WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE DEALT WITH!!!!
reviews.title: Worse Service, Bookings Totally Messed Up For Group To Attend Daughter's Wedding

reviews.text: I just wanna say thak-you days inn your staff saved our family trip we had reservations at log cabin resort we had these revervations since may 2010,we were leaving fri evening the 13th from tacoma wash. for our granddaughters 1st birthday when we found out that log cabin resort management had cancelled our reservations on aug 10, and we had NO idea of this.so days inn found us a room last min that would acomadate our family so thank you again....Hugdahl family Tacoma Wa.
reviews.title: THANK-YOU DAYS INN

reviews.text: This is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The reviews stating that this is a decent stay must be rigged by management. Here's our laundry list of complaints: The carpet is old, filthy & covered in stains (the kind you wouldn't want to walk around barefoot on). The bedding isn't any better... old & dirty. It is so cheap the beds don't even have a fitted sheet (just a flat sheet barely tucked in), mattress cover or bedskirt. And they are extremely uncomfortable. The fluorescent vanity light flickers on & off when using the outlets near it. So, while drying our hair we had a strobe light show... not easy on the eyes. The shower is dingy looking with brown stains up the sides of the tub and there is extremely low water pressure... so good luck getting the shampoo out your hair. There is only one sink in our double room. There is no ironing board or iron in the room. If you need that or any other "extra amenities" you have to trek down to the office to pick it up. At one point during our stay, the toilet (for no apparent reason) overflowed. When we called the front desk, we were told that there was only one person on staff so no one was available to help. We had to walk to the front desk to get supplies to mop up & sanitize the mess ourselves. Our room then smelled like sewage the rest of the night... obviously there are some pretty serious plumbing issues going on as well. To sum it all up, everything about this place is poorly maintained. This was a horrible stay for us... one that we won't soon forget unfortunately. Spend a little more money for a better quality place. And learn from our mistake... read the reviews before making a reservation!
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night here during our trip to the Olympic National Park. Our room was clean, large and did not smell (room 230). I think the room cost about $80 and a continental breakfast was included! It was a perfect stop over for the night and in a great location.
reviews.title: Perfect location to explore Olympic Park

reviews.text: Stayed in a suite at the hotel for only one night (thankfully!). Room wasn't clean with sofa bed in the lounge being particularly bad. Blanket was filthy and the bed was unstable. Breakfast choice was very poor. I suppose you get what you pay for but having paid $170 for a one night stay, we did expect more.
reviews.title: Not good -look elsewhere!
